data.message: So that is blatantly sexist. Are coke going to show a topless woman in their next commercial? I don't believe so. It should be one rule for all. Why do we need sex to sell a fizzy drink anyway?

replies.message: About time u had blokes on its usually women for men all time !
I believe there was an advert containing a topless man drinking coke outside an office window and all the women where gawking at him. Its quite a famous advert and you know what they say. Sex sells.
Sharon Selwood it's never woman being objectified never ever ever ever. Show me on advert this happens.

They can't, because a topless woman would be seen as indecent and a topless man isn't - ie men have more freedom than women and can takes there tops off without fear of assault. Incidently, he had a top. It was just open. Hardly cavorting in his underwear.
How many adverts objectify women Andy? Plus woman can't go topless as it's seen as indecent...it's not indecent for men tho.
